testcase.brief: The nat-policy capacity on one tunnel interface is 16 Platform Dependence BR100,BR200,BRAP330,BRAP350
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: 1. establish vpn tunnel between ${br1.br.wan.int1} of BR and CVG1 2. establish vpn tunnel between ${br1.br.wan.int1} of BR and CVG2
Test Procedure: 1. Configure 17 non-routable subnet on br 2. Configure 17 routable subnet on br 3. Configure 17 1:1 NAT nat-policy on br, 4. apply 16 1:1 nat policy on tunnel0 over ${br1.br.wan.int1},check result 1 5. apply another 1:1 nat policy on tunnel0 over ${br1.br.wan.int1},check result2 6. delete one of the 1:1 NAT nat-policy on tunnel0 interface,check result 3 7. add another 1:1 NAT nat-policy on tunnel0 over ${br1.br.wan.int1},check result 4 8. add another 1:1 NAT nat-policy on tunnel1 over ${br1.br.wan.int1},check result 4 9. save configuration and reboot the br, check the nat-policy, result 5 10. from every subnet rconnect to vpn network,check the result 6

step.telnet: -v "ip nat-policy n_${loop.v} type match-net inside ${inside.test.subnet}/${br.lan.netmask} outside ${outside.test.subnet}/${br.lan.netmask}"

step.desc: apply 16 1:1 nat policy on tunnel0 over ${br1.br.wan.int1},configuration is successful
apply another 1:1 nat policy on tunnel0 over ${br1.br.wan.int1},configuration is failed
step.log-match: -c -i "Maximum number (16) of nat policies has been configured on ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name}"

step.desc: delete one of the 1:1 NAT nat-policy on tunnel0 interface
step.telnet: -v "no vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} nat-policy n_16" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel2.name} vpn-mode layer-3"
-v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} nat-policy n_17" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel2.name} nat-policy n_16"
